members.name: dispose
members.comment: Releases the resources allocated for the operation.

members.name: getColorModel
members.comment: Returns the ColorModel of the output. Note that this ColorModel might be different from the hint specified in the createContext method of Paint. Not all PaintContext objects are capable of generating color patterns in an arbitrary ColorModel.

members.name: getRaster
members.comment: Returns a Raster containing the colors generated for the graphics operation.

param: x - the x coordinate of the area in device space for which colors are generated.
y - the y coordinate of the area in device space for which colors are generated.
w - the width of the area in device space
h - the height of the area in device space
return: a Raster representing the specified rectangular area and containing the colors generated for the graphics operation.

name: java.awt.PaintContext
comment: The PaintContext interface defines the encapsulated and optimized environment to generate color patterns in device space for fill or stroke operations on a Graphics2D. The PaintContext provides the necessary colors for Graphics2D operations in the form of a Raster associated with a ColorModel. The PaintContext maintains state for a particular paint operation. In a multi-threaded environment, several contexts can exist simultaneously for a single Paint object.
